content: The Retirement Savings and Security Act is also known as the Short Title Act. It includes provisions for additional retirement participation and payment options for Federal employees, such as immediate participation in the Thrift Savings Plan and deferred annuities for surviving spouses. The Retirement Savings and Security Act, also known as the Short Title Act, provides additional retirement options for Federal employees. It includes immediate participation in the Thrift Savings Plan and deferred annuities for surviving spouses. Amendments to section 8432(b) of title 5, United States Code, allow employees and Members to make elections under certain conditions determined by the Executive Director. The Retirement Savings and Security Act offers new retirement choices for Federal employees, including immediate Thrift Savings Plan enrollment and annuities for surviving spouses. Employees can make elections under specified conditions set by the Executive Director. Contributions under subsections (c)(1) and (c)(2) are not required before the earliest allowable pay period determined by the Executive Director. Section 8432(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to allow for contributions under a program of regular contributions provided in regulations prescribed by the Executive Director. Section 8432 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to allow for contributions under a program of regular contributions as prescribed by the Executive Director. Additionally, various sections within the title are amended to make changes related to individual contributions to the Thrift Savings Fund and the dissemination of information. Section 8432 of title 5, United States Code is amended to allow contributions under a program prescribed by the Executive Director. Sections 8440a(a)(2) and 8440d(a)(2) are amended to be subject to this chapter. The effective date of this section is 6 months after enactment or an earlier date set by the Executive Director. SEC. 2002. DEFERRED ANNUITIES FOR SURVIVING SPOUSES OF FEDERAL EMPLOYEES. Section 8341 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to allow a surviving spouse of a deceased former employee who separated with a deferred annuity under section 8338 to receive an annuity equal to 55 percent of the former employee's deferred annuity if the former employee dies before establishing a valid claim for annuity. The amendment allows a surviving spouse of a deceased former employee to receive an annuity equal to 55 percent of the former employee's deferred annuity. The annuity terminates if the surviving spouse remarries before age 55 or dies. The United States Code is amended to allow surviving spouses and former spouses of former employees to receive an annuity. The amendments apply to spouses whose marriage ended after May 6, 1985, and the annuity terminates if the surviving spouse remarries before age 55 or dies. SEC. 2003. Payment of lump-sum credit for former spouses of federal employees. Title 5, United States Code, is amended to include provisions regarding lump-sum payments under various sections. Any payment under this subsection to a person bars recovery by any other person. The Title 5, United States Code, is amended to include provisions for lump-sum payments to individuals entitled under specific sections. The amendments apply to deaths occurring after the 90th day following the enactment of the Act.
